title: Honoring Gregory T. Cerchione, Esq. upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Gregory  T.  Cerchione, Esq. upon the
occasion of his designation for special recognition by the Federation of
Italian-American Organizations of Brooklyn, Ltd.

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that  the
quality  and  character of life in the communities across New York State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those  individ-
uals who devote themselves to the welfare of the community and its citi-
zenry; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor Gregory T.
Cerchione, Esq. upon the occasion of his designation for special  recog-
nition  by the Federation of Italian-American Organizations of Brooklyn,
Ltd., to be celebrated at its 34th Anniversary Gala on March  27,  2011;
and
  WHEREAS,  Gregory T. Cerchione is a managing and litigating partner of
Subin Associates L.L.P. and concentrates his law practice in plaintiff's
personal injury; he is also an appointed member of the  New  York  State
Appellate  Division,  Second  Department  Committees  on  Character  and
Fitness for the 2nd, 10th, 11th and  13th  Judicial  Districts;  he  has
interviewed  and  screened  applicants  to  the New York State Bar since
2002; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Gregory T. Cerchione  chairs  the  Brooklyn  Bar
Association Grievance Committee and serves on several Judicial Screening
Committees;  he is a Past President of the Brooklyn Bar Association, the
Columbian Lawyers Association of Brooklyn and the Catholic Lawyers Guild
of Brooklyn; he is a sustaining member of the New York State Bar Associ-
ation and the New York State Bar  Association  Foundation;  a  Barrister
with  the  Nathan  R.  Sobel  Kings  County American Inns of Court and a
Director of the New York State Trial Lawyers Association; and
  WHEREAS, Despite his busy professional life, Gregory T. Cerchione  has
been called upon to contribute his time and talents to countless endeav-
ors and has always given of himself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS, Gregory T. Cerchione is Knight of the Equestrian Order of the
Holy  Sepulcher  of Jerusalem, a Third Degree Knight of Columbus, serves
as recording Secretary to the Mary Queen of Heaven Advisory School Board
and is an active member of the Bergen Beach (Brooklyn)  Youth  Organiza-
tion; and
  WHEREAS,  In recognition of his efforts of in-depth magnitude, Gregory
T.   Cerchione has  received  numerous  awards  and  accolades;  he  was
presented  the  Special  Recognition  Award  by the Brooklyn Woman's Bar
Association in 2003, the Brooklyn Bar Association Annual Award  in  2007
and, in 2009, received the Catholic Lawyers Saint Thomas More Award, the
Brooklyn  Bar  Association  Volunteer  Lawyers  Leadership Award and the
Greater New York Councils' Annual Boy  Scouts  of  America  "Outstanding
Community Service Award"; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual  for  the benefit of others which Gregory T. Cerchione has displayed
throughout his life; and
  WHEREAS, With him throughout have been his wife, Lisa, and their three
children, all of whom feel privileged to be  a  part  of  his  life  and
rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the  sense  of  this Legislative Body that those who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained commitment to the  maintenance  of  high  standards  in  their
profession,  certainly  have  earned the recognition and applause of all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Gregory  T.  Cerchione, Esq. upon the occasion of his designation
for special recognition by the Federation of Italian-American  Organiza-
tions of Brooklyn, Ltd.; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Gregory T. Cerchione, Esq.
